1.text: And Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind and said,

2.text: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

3.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man; and I will demand of thee, and inform thou me.

4.text: Where wast thou when I founded the earth? Declare, if thou hast understanding.

5.text: Who set the measures thereof—if thou knowest? or who stretched a line upon it?

6.text: Whereupon were the foundations thereof sunken? or who laid its corner-stone,

7.text: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

8.text: And who shut up the sea with doors, when it burst forth, issuing out of the womb?

9.text: When I made the cloud its garment, and thick darkness a swaddling band for it;

10.text: When I cut out for it my boundary, and set bars and doors,

11.text: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come and no further, and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?

12.text: Hast thou since thy days commanded the morning? hast thou caused the dawn to know its place,

13.text: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, and the wicked might be shaken out of it?

14.text: It is changed like the signet-clay; and [all things] stand forth as in a garment:

15.text: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the uplifted arm is broken.

16.text: Hast thou entered as far as the springs of the sea? and hast thou walked in the recesses of the deep?

17.text: Have the gates of death been revealed unto thee? and hast thou seen the gates of the shadow of death?

18.text: Hath thine understanding compassed the breadths of the earth? Declare if thou knowest it all.

19.text: Where is the way to where light dwelleth? and the darkness, where is its place,

20.text: That thou shouldest take it to its bound, and that thou shouldest know the paths to its house?

21.text: Thou knowest, for thou wast then born, and the number of thy days is great!

22.text: Hast thou entered into the storehouses of the snow, and hast thou seen the treasuries of the hail,

23.text: Which I have reserved for the time of distress, for the day of battle and war?

24.text: By what way is the light parted, [and] the east wind scattered upon the earth?

25.text: Who hath divided a channel for the rain-flood, and a way for the thunder’s flash;

26.text: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no one is; on the wilderness wherein there is not a man;

27.text: To satisfy the desolate and waste [ground], and to cause the sprout of the grass to spring forth?

28.text: Hath the rain a father? or who begetteth the drops of dew?

29.text: Out of whose womb cometh the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who bringeth it forth?

30.text: When the waters lie hidden as in stone, and the face of the deep holdeth fast together.

31.text: Canst thou fasten the bands of the Pleiades, or loosen the cords of Orion?

32.text: Dost thou bring forth the constellations each in its season? or dost thou guide the Bear with her sons?

33.text: Knowest thou the ordinances of the heavens? dost thou determine their rule over the earth?

34.text: Dost thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that floods of waters may cover thee?

35.text: Dost thou send forth lightnings that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?

36.text: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the mind?

37.text: Who numbereth the clouds with wisdom? or who poureth out the bottles of the heavens,

38.text: When the dust runneth as into a molten mass, and the clods cleave fast together?

39.text: Dost thou hunt the prey for the lioness, and dost thou satisfy the appetite of the young lions,

40.text: When they crouch in [their] dens, [and] abide in the thicket to lie in wait?

41.text: Who provideth for the raven his food, when his young ones cry unto God, [and] they wander for lack of meat?
